header: Test vectors of class RsassaPssVerify are intended for checking the

ModifiedSignature.description: The test vector contains an invalid signature. This signature was obtained by modifying the padding before signing it.
ModifiedSignature.effect: Accepting modified paddings may indicate that the verification is implemented by decoding the encoded message EM instead of encoding the hash as described in Section 8.2.2 of RFC 8017. A carelessly implemented decoding operation can lead to signature forgeries.

Normal.description: The test vector contains a pseudorandomly generated, valid test case. Implementations are expected to pass this test.

SpecialCaseHash.description: The test vector contains a signature where the hash of the message is a special case, e.g., contains a long run of 0 or 1 bits.

WrongPrimitive.description: The signature is a valid PKCS #1 v1.5 signature. Expected was an RSASSA-PSS signature. Implementations should not accept multiple signature schemes.

tests.comment: all bytes in zero padding modified
first byte of hash h modified
first byte of hash h modified
last byte of hash h modified
last byte of hash h modified
all bytes of h replaced by 0
all bits of h replaced by 1s
all bits in hash h flipped
all bytes of ps changed to 0xff
all bytes of ps changed to 0x80
first byte of masked_db changed to 0
